elements.title: Ludwig Grass (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1857 Ludwig Grass (pictured) donated 20,000 guilders to build the first state secondary school in Liechtenstein?

elements.title: Agora Hills (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Agora Hills" is named after the location of the ashram where Doja Cat lived growing up?

elements.title: 2024 Masters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after winning the 2024 Masters, snooker player Ronnie O'Sullivan is both the youngest and oldest winner of the tournament?

elements.title: Shovel Knight Showdown (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Shovel Knight Showdown started as a fundraising goal for the Kickstarter of the original game?

elements.title: Nick Whiteside (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nick Whiteside overcame a torn Achilles tendon in 2021 and a broken foot in 2022 to play in the National Football League in 2023?

elements.title: Salmon Report (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Salmon Report (1966) led to the loss of the job title "matron" from UK hospitals?

elements.title: Joan Phillip (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Joan Phillip offered to give any MLAs who were rude to her a whack with her Saskatoon berry stick?

elements.title: ibedul succession dispute (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the ibedul succession dispute, Gloria Salii held a ceremony for her son in which he washed his hands in turtle blood?
